alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 23 at 4:41AM AKST until November 23 at 1:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley, mainly south and west of Wasilla. * WHEN...Through 1 PM AKST Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A wintry mix will transition to light freezing rain by mid to late morning. Periods of light freezing rain are expected through Thursday morning before temperatures warm above freezing. The best chance for ice accumulation will be south and west of the Parks Highway.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
